body:
I guess we could either add a `return` after `log.Error("Could not get changed files between...`, or change the `return review, err` to `return review, nil`?

https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/blob/a789a8cc7a373990fbee33f25a91b537e275557f/services/gitdiff/gitdiff.go#L1337

Contributions are welcome! Thank you very much. (This one might not be a "good first issue" for new contributors ðŸ˜„ but you can try ðŸ™ )

well, I love challenges and I have a lot of free time right now and nothing to do ðŸ¤£, so i am going to try to fix this BUG "TODAY" ðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜Ž

> bad object e6b6c01d0dc37b0e52b20cb558f967219f3c07be

Yeah, the force push sounds like the problem to me:
You probably reviewed on a commit that has since been force-pushed away and has been GC'ed by git.
As such, we can no longer determine the diff between `commit at review time..current commit` with `e6b6c01d0dc37b0e52b20cb558f967219f3c07be..284cc007c63d1a560da9dfd3cd7d62f5e5fc3121`.
However, as the message states what should have happened is the following:
The map of files changed in the mean time should have simply been empty instead of filled.
It sounds like a regression that we now receive a 500.

issue.title: Ignore force pushes for changed files in a PR review

body:
Found and corrected the problem with #34837.
The expected behavior is `no file is marked as changed, page renders normally`
